title: Has anyone cleared the UPSC with the physics optional? - Quora

response.answer_text: Why Physics optional? Physics is getting very popular as an optional subject these days. Only four to five standard books are more than enough to prepare Physics optional in depth. If you have even a moderate interest in Physics, try to go through some books of university level. If you can develop logic, see your understanding going in any direction and it does not bore you, it’s for you. Once you begin understanding Physics, you have the chances that you can exploit it at any level. UPSC Preparation Tips UPSC Aspirants should follow exam tips to write the exam. Preparation tips are needed for any exam. UPSC exam should be conducted once in every year. Planning and hard work are very important to face any competitive exam. Below are some of the tips for preparation.The Paper I of Physics Optional paper is which is like classical mechanics, statistical physics. But Paper II of Physics optional deals with Quantum physics, modern physics, electronics. Step 1: Know UPSC Physics syllabus In the previous article, we’ve provided UPSC Mains Physics Syllabus. You can check and find what are the applicable topics and chapter for UPSC IAS Mains 2019 Exam.Step 2: Select Best Reference Books for UPSC Physics To prepare UPSC Physics Optional Subject, UPSC aspirants should prepare some reference books.
